subject: Plack 1.0 released
header: I am sorry for sending out this newsletter later than usual. I was too busy working on the Perl 6 Maven site. Finally I fixed the code that generates the HTML pages from simple XML-ish format I am still using to write my courses. This mean now I 'only' need to update the content and it will become useful again.

entries.text: I don't know if you attach any meaning to the 1.0 release number, but if you do, Tatsuhiko Miyagawa has just released version 1.0 of Plack. He also describes how the development will change

entries.title: How to test Perl 6 modules and scripts?
entries.text: I think the only reasonable way to ensure a piece of code survives an upgrade is to write automated unit tests. This is true regardless of language. Even in the conservative Perl 5 there were and there will be changed that break code. And don't even talk about PHP, Python or Ruby. Naturally Perl 6 still has some time till it stabilizes, so it is even more important to write unit-tests for your Perl 6 modules and scripts.

entries.title: Welcome all scientists and friends to perl4science.github.com
